intro: Blepharis laevifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are smooth and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are usually pale blue or purple. Blepharis laevifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
